alert.note: Alert for Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 20 at 12:25AM EST until December 20 at 9:09AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Vermont... Winooski River At Essex Junction affecting Chittenden County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winooski River at Essex Junction. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...Until the river stage falls below 12.5 feet, water will continue to cover North Williston Road in Essex and Pine Island Road in Colchester. Low lying farmland in the Burlington Intervale will remain flooded, as well as farmland along the Winooski from Bolton through Burlington. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 PM EST Tuesday was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling to 5.1 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.6 feet on 11/02/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 915 AM EST.
